overview: From personal healing, inspiration grew to create a positive film about people addressing disease with food. There are a lot of negative messages about the state of our nation's health and diet, and we were inspired by the community of people we found who are fighting back against this downward trend. Food As Medicine is a documentary film that follows the growing movement of using food to heal chronic illness and disease.
title: Food As Medicine

overview: Danny D has just died and gone to Teen Heaven. That's because waiting for him is none other than Liza Rowe and Chloe Couture, a pair of angelic fuck machines blessed with heavenly bodies...  If Dad Won't Help, Strangers Will Elsa's a total daddy girl, but there's one thing he won't buy his princess: a car. Sick of taking the bus, Elsa will do anything for her own wheels...  Tiny Teen Hooker Scarlett might seem like your average teen, but she loves fucking for money! Today's client is a mysterious older man who leaves her a nice stack of cash and instructions to get naked before he arrives...  Pounding Piper Piper may look sweet and innocent, but underneath her youthful exterior she's a cock crazed sex fiend...  Your Dick Roommate's Dick One day Skyla Novea wakes up at her boyfriends' place. Her BF has already left, leaving her home alone with his roommate Tyler. Skyla decides to leave, but Tyler is hogging the shower...
title: Teen Temptations 2

overview: The Big Bang has nothing on this.
title: Megatrick

overview: Based on the comic book by Tetsu Kusamoto.
title: Yokohama Bakkuretai: Natsu no Shounan jun'ai hen

overview: Based on the comic book by Tetsu Kusamoto.
title: Yokohama Bakkuretai: Junjô goromaki shitô hen

overview: Two travelers’ (a Hong Kong independent director and a Japanese musician) motorcycle diaries in northern China from November 2005 to February 2006.  Forget all the vital intellectual and history garbage and get down to the real simple, good human feeling – and express it in a simple language that reaches people. No bullshit! (Or all bullshit?) Under the sound of the motor, Yanyan’s visual and Dean’s music weaves into each other; and shows the healing power of the trip to both the Chinese and Japanese souls.  Everybody, at a certain point, is a little lost and sometimes we just find a connection to someone that helps to re-inspire or center us. And that experience we'll never forget.  It’s a special relationship in real life - a little bit more than friends but not an actual romance. They get each other and they both know it's not going to go anywhere.
title: 2 Cartons of Alphabet H

overview: Salim Shaheen film from Afghanistan
title: Iʻlān-i jang

overview: 1995 short film
title: 100%G

overview: Lovers on the Road follows Lei as she moves to Beijing for her boyfriend’s job, despite their rocky relationship. She starts a project interviewing other outsiders about Beijing and what they miss. One outsider, estranged from his family in Tokyo, takes Lei on a journey of self discovery…  This debut feature marks out Tsang Tsui Shan as director to watch, and we are delighted to welcome Tsang Tsui Shan to introduce this screening and for a post-screening Q&A.
title: Lovers on the Road

overview: Love More Hong Kong
title: Love More Hong Kong

overview: The Life and Times of Ho Chung Village
title: The Life and Times of Ho Chung Village

overview: Salim Shaheen film from Afghanistan about drugs and addiction.
title: Ajall

overview: AGAINST FILIAL PIETY ponders one of the oldest Chinese beliefs; the gravest offense of filial piety is not to have offspring to carry on the family name and blood.  The film also relates to feelings of failure in not being able to fulfill the filial responsibility.  This five minute, single framed, 16mm experimental film includes the word “barren” from 34 different written languages, which were extracted from dictionaries.  The individual word or symbol disintegrates as it being enlarged to resemble landscapes or graphic shapes.  The colorful technical drawing s of human anatomy and the cycle of childbirth are combined and contrasted against the monotone enlargement of Xerox copies of the word “barren” which breaks up and converges through out the progression of film.
title: Against Filial Piety

overview: A young woman records her feelings about her mother's illness in a stream of consciousness manner.
title: Arrythmia

overview: A low budget but slick "who done it" involving the murder of a wealthy businessman. The long list of suspects includes the family butler, their shady attorney, and an assortment of greedy business partners who have all been called together for the reading of the will. But first there is a seance to communicate with the dead man. From the producers of "Tattletale Corpse" and "Burial Island".
title: 1 Dead man, 6 Suspects, $65 Million

overview: Law enforcement vs. outlaw gang.
title: La diosa de Tahití

overview: Lumière short on the 1900 World's Fair.
title: L'exposition universelle de 1900. Petit Palais et Grand Palais

overview: Very short impression of the famous Parisian nightclub in 1900, at the time of the World's Fair
title: Vue de Moulin-Rouge

overview: Futurist short.
title: Conversation with Boxing Gloves

overview: A documentary about Swiss media from WWII to today, focussing on Hannes Hug's personal vision.
title: Generation Teleboy

overview: Isolated yet together, two women share another ordinary day.
title: Megan

overview: Danny D was Brazzers' biggest fan until a freak electrical storm sucked him into his computer. Now he's trapped inside the Brazzers Universe, hopping from site to site! Can he fuck his way through the entire network before the evil Head of Brazzers has him deleted from the system?
title: Lost in Brazzers

overview: The true story of the events leading up to the infamous massacre of the Macdonalds by the Campbells in February of 1692.
title: The Massacre of Glencoe

overview: 2011 short by Cheuk Wan Chi
title: Wrong Number

overview: 2011 short film by Cheuk Wan Chi
title: One Minute

overview: 2007 short film by Cheuk Wan Chi
title: Lost & Found

overview: Set during the 10th anniversary of Hong Kong's reunification with China, FOG tells the story of Wai, who suffers from a rare amnesia that wipes his memory entirely clean, as he attempts to restart his life and embarks on a journey of self-discovery and redemption.
title: Fog

overview: Samuel's girlfriend, Jenn, is missing. To search for her, Samuel follows a mysterious trail of words written on pieces of paper left by Jenn in the most unlikely places. As he uncovers the mystery of Jenn's disappearance, Samuel catches a haunting glimpse of New York City and realizes something unexpected.
title: Missing

overview: A girl raped by criminals that live in the mountains. A man manages to trace the criminals in the mountains but they also kill him. Later on his brother reaches and takes revenge on the criminals.
title: Gilah-i shaykh

overview: Salim Shaheen film from Afghanistan
title: Kazdum-i siyāh

overview: Salim Shaheen film from Afghanistan
title: Game

overview: Since the end of eighties, Hong Kong has been through tremendous changes -- re unification with China, economic downturn, political reform, etc, have all greatly affected our way of life. In the film, about sixty people are invited to talk about their views on several major socio-economic and political issues.
title: Speaking Up

overview: Ngau Tau Kok Estate is one of the oldest and largest public housing projects in Hong Kong. Most of the residents are either elderly and live alone, or working class families. Since 2001, after the government announced its plan to redevelop the area, residents have been gradually relocated to new housing estates. Following two social workers who work with the residents as they deal with the relocation, the film offers is a glimpse of the lives of old people. It is a group portrait of our parents and grandparents.
title: Moving

overview: Using the same interview techniques applied in her highly successful Speaking Up (2005), Tammy Cheung turns her attention from Hong Kong to Mainland China. In Speaking Up II, she interviews around two dozen students from a well-respected primary school in Jiangxu (near Shanghai). They are asked to express their views on different topics such as personal issues, family, gender, society, and more. Presented in a skilfully edited montage and intertwined with footage of their daily lives at school, their answers highlight the changing face of today’s China.
title: Speaking Up 2

overview: “Sino Philes” is a mockumentary microfilm web series and short film about Hong Kong and Mainland social conflicts.  In an attempt to reconnect with their roots, a Chinese Canadian couple relocates to Hong Kong, China, and consequently becomes entangled in bizarre social conflicts between Hongkongers and Mainlanders that ultimately lead them to discover what it means to be "Chinese" and what the "Chinese dream" means to them.  http://sinophiles.slatetakes.com/
title: Sino Philes

overview: A journey into the feminine erotic mind.
title: The Mistress

overview: 1998 short film by Carol Lai Miu-Suet
title: Father’s Toy

overview: September 1994 saw Frank Skinner's live show, unleashed, untamed and uncensored and coming from the Apollo Theatre straight to your front room.
title: Frank Skinner Live at the Apollo

overview: Joe’s salute to the icons of British blues features the unbelievable music of Eric Clapton, Jeff Beck, and Jimmy Page! Joe recently paid tribute to his heroes during a short but very sweet tour of Britain – 5 performances only. This show was recorded at Greenwich Music Time at The Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, London on July 7, 2016.
title: Joe Bonamassa: British Blues Explosion Live

overview: Krazy Kat runs his own lighthouse and when rough seas take over, he has to save a damsel in distress.
title: Lighthouse Keeping

overview: A man holds a woman in his dungeon, ties her up and suspends her from the ceiling. He then goes through the do's and don'ts of making a snuff film.
title: The Rope Maiden

overview: The video is a narrative game reconstructing Lai's own video diaries (1990-2003) and found footage. It plays with the thin line between remembering and fabricating, recording and staging, documentary and story... It shows 13 women's stories as a network of acquaintances, each in an isolated moment of her life. Questions on the practice of auto-ethnography are raised via "the politics of the everyday."
title: I Told Them My Camera Was On

overview: Door Game is a narrative game playing with the found footage of a number of family ethics melodramas from HK Cantonese cinema of the 1950s and 1960s.  By re-assembling loose fragments into some kind of coherent structures, I reveal the hidden logic of the genre, exposing the repetitive elements.  Through story-creation, my critique of the gender-biased, formulaic quality inherent to Cantonese melodramas evolves.  I want to expose the arbitrariness of pathos and ethos in the Cantonese melodramatic tradition, especially to point out how narrative logic turns open options into moral necessity, and how a particular form of morality is turned into absolute truth via plotting… - http://www.lindalai-floatingsite.com/content/video/data/published/doorgame/index.html
title: Door Game

overview: The myth of Cinderella undergoes a series of generative twist to illumine the inventive power of speech. 11 children and 3 educated women engaged in a game of improvisation via their talking-head camera presence. Tale-telling to some children is the realization of creative instincts, to others the performance of self, or it's simply a tedious pedagogic vessel. My research-creation completes with adult women transforming the usage of Cinderella-objects into agents of their own stories, however fragmentary or elliptical. The event of tale-telling woke up the child in them; children language was appropriated to perform unarticulated subjectivities. Gender is a complex system, most revealing in language-in-action. The coda is a grand finale celebrating the magical power of objects and their own unlimited lives. Story-telling is the most primitive form of play. Harmless it may look, it is also the most sophisticated embodiment of ideological workings.
title: Excitable Speech: All About Cinderella

overview: I have been a fervent walker of the city and a detached collector of sights and sounds. Most of the outdoor sites in this work no long exist in current maps of Hong Kong, or they have never existed as practical, concrete dwellings.
title: Non-Place/Other Space

overview: It is an episodic movie about Ashora and social subjects made from 4 episodes each with a different director and about a different subject.
title: Heyhaat

overview: Based on the comic book series by Shuushi Mizuho. First of a series that included two theatrically released films and two direct-to-video films.
title: High School Jingi

overview: Black Beauty is a wild horse born free in the American west. As she is rounded up and taken away from her family, her story intertwines with that of a teenager, ‘Jo Green’ , similarly grieving over the loss of her parents.The two develop a bond crafted in love, trust and healing.
title: Black Beauty

overview: Based on the comic book series by Shuushi Mizuho.
title: High School Jingi 2: Taihen yoku dekimashita

overview: Geronimo is the contemporary Sisyphus. Abandoned and condemned by oneself, it pushes the failure to identify itself, on an individual or collective plane. Between the symbolic and the real, it makes us reflect: What does each carry? Or leave the road? What force really makes life spin? The truth? Love? In this Mise en abyme, Geronimo goes through his questions, but much more ours.
title: Gerônimo

overview: Walter is a grumpy old man who suffers from his loneliness and sees suicide as the only way out. His neighbor, the lonely Vera, hopes that Walter will be the company he needs. She tries to conquer Walter using the talent she has in the kitchen. Between the two, there is the porter Zezinho, young Don Juan who sees no problem at all in living alone.
title: Walter do 402

overview: Based on the comic book series by Shuushi Mizuho.
title: High School Jingi 3: Saraba jouji

overview: A week away from leaving for his first year of college, Michael starts to become frustrated with his parent's overprotective tendencies toward his teen brother Nathan, who has Down syndrome.
title: A Normal Life

overview: Based on the comic book series by Kengo Kaji and Tetsuya Saruwatari.
title: DAN-GAN kyôshi
Das Kamel geht durch das Nadelöhr

overview: Receiving a tip from his dentist Jack Shorter, policeman Peter Pascoe takes a closer look at the Calliope Kinema Club, a film club notorious for showing adult entertainment movies. Shorter is convinced that one particular scene in a movie he recently saw was too realistic to have been staged with fake blood, but when Pascoe and his bluff superior Andy Dalziel starts investigating, they soon comes across the actress in question, Linda Abbott, who obviously didn't suffer from any harm and assures Pascoe that the concerns are unnecessary.
title: A Pinch of Snuff

overview: 'Mario Merz' was made in San Gimignano in Tuscany, Italy where Dean was invited to a residency in summer 2002. Dean's film is a study of the ageing artist in the last year of his life. Merz is observed sitting in silence under a tree, a large pinecone in his hand. The film is ostensibly a portrait, but more importantly is a study of light in space and form in nature - central concerns in Merz's sculptural investigations.
title: Mario Merz

overview: We follow the world's leading experts on a quest to unlock the mysteries surrounding the Tomb of Christ. At the heart of the story a team of leading scientists use the latest scientific techniques to restore the edicule housing the tomb. Scientific tests indicate the remnants of the tomb dates to 4th century - a discovery that could revolutionize what we know about the tomb of Christ.
title: Secrets of Christ's Tomb: Explorer Special

overview: August 1939. The fate of four young people, Ramona, Georges, Brigitte and Hans is upset by the outbreak of war.
title: Shattered Lives

overview: A young Viking called Vitharr arrives in Britain with dreams of conquest and adventure, but when his family and clan are ambushed and killed, he must survive alone in this strange,dangerous new land as he searches for his Uncle's settlement.
title: The Lost Viking

overview: A local occasion filmed at Rapahoe Beach on the West Coast of the South Island.
title: Official Opening of McTaggart Esplanade

overview: A prestidigitator, one of the best, is about to perform a number of illusions and brings to his aid a pack of playing cards. He selects the King of Spades, endows him with life and seats him at the table with himself, and they proceed to play a game of cards. The King of Spades shows a disposition to be ugly and is immediately squelched. This is a remarkably good picture, interesting from start to finish.
title: Métamorphose du roi de pique

overview: Filmed at London’s Hammersmith Odeon in 1982, this spectacular concert showcases Teddy at the peak of his powers. Performing hits from his four platinum albums — Teddy Pendergrass, Life Is A Song Worth Singing, Teddy and TP — the R&B legend delights the London crowd with energetic soul stompers and steamy serenades. The concert concludes with a rousing rendition of “Reach Out And Touch (Somebody’s Hand),” as Teddy is joined onstage by an adorable chorus of London schoolchildren.
title: Teddy Pendergrass: Live in '82

overview: It's a three-colour separation study of MacKenzie Falls in the Grampians, Victoria.
title: Waterfall

overview: A man reads a horror novel late at night. His imagination runs away with him; he thinks some dripping beverage is blood, is frightened by his own bear-skin rug, and faints when he sees a shadow of himself in a noose-like tangle of his phone cord. The ambulance arrives and finds the most threatening thing is a kitten in a sock and a shelf of horror novels. They cart off the novels and leave the man.
title: Who's Scared

overview: Once upon a time there lived a poor fisherman in a dilapidated dugout on the seashore. He went to the sea on a boat, he was fishing. And once he caught an old bottle on which was the inscription that the one who opens this bottle, will receive untold treasures, become noble and rich. The fisherman, of course, without hesitation, opened the bottle, and from there the Genie burst out. He laughed at the fisherman, called him a bitch, but he fulfilled the promise, giving him a lot of gold. And the fisherman became the richest and most revered, but this did not bring any treasures to him, because the release on freedom the Genie, caused many troubles - as a result of the storms many fishermen fell. The fisherman, suffering with conscience, went to a wise wizard to ask how to rid the world of the cruel Genie. And he replied that there is only one way out.
title: The Legend of the Cruel Giant

overview: When a young Santosh’s ammamma Sita Mahalakshmi once helps him hide during a game of hide and seek he’s playing with his Maradalu Sita, he takes it to heart. 20 years later, he makes it his personal mission to keep her happy, even if it means achieving the near impossible.
title: Ammammagarillu

overview: A carefree young man is forced to alter his life due to a shocking event that takes place in his life. He fights against an evil, corrupt politician to get justice for the society.
title: Nela Ticket

overview: The Ramones at the US Festival in San Bernadino, CA on September 3rd, 1982.  Also included in Ramones - It's Alive
title: Ramones - Live at US Festival

overview: When he was told he’d be interviewing rock stars Neil Finn and Nick Seymour, Charles Wooley was expecting stories about sex, drugs and rock and roll. Instead he got cops, rabbis and missing money. But Neil and Nick’s beloved Australian – and Kiwi – band Crowded House has always been a little bit different. It seems like only yesterday they first sang their way into our heads and hearts, but in fact they’ve been writing and performing their hit songs for 30 years. So to celebrate the milestone, Neil and Nick took Charles on a nostalgic journey back to where it all started.
title: House Proud

overview: Summer. During the admission to the acting school, Lisa gets acquainted with one of the entrants and leads him to the sculpture workshop of her father, where they spend several days together. In a closed space, their relationship becomes a game. Without borders, without time, without skin. An intimate depiction of a passionate, and sometimes violent, relationship between two young actors at an acting school in St Petersburg.
title: Without Skin

overview: A 2010 Thai zombie film.
title: Zombie Sexy Girl

overview: Short film about life in the Dutch rural province of Noord-Brabant

overview: Floris and Anna have a one-night-stand in Budapest. They decide to meet up again in Amsterdam.

overview: Madrid, Spain. The bedroom of Sofía, a luxury escort. Her new client, who has introduced himself as Hugo and appears to be an educated businessman, discovers that she has a name tattooed on her leg: Diana. Hugo cannot help asking her who Diana is.

overview: Short film by Helga Fanderl from the FRAGIL(E) DVD.

overview: Short film by Helga Fanderl from the FRAGIL(E) DVD.

overview: Compilation of anime music videos and other fan-made anime clips.

overview: Would you go to therapy with crazy family members to collect millions? It wouldn't be as easy as you think. - When the family matriarch, Big Mama, passes away, her dying wish is to make sure the family she raised address their personal demons. Now, her dysfunctional family must seek unconventional therapy in order to get a multi-million dollar inheritance. Chaos ensues as they are forced to deal with old rivalries, volatile marriages, and failed dreams.
title: Not Another Black Movie

overview: Part of the Optofonica #1 series
title: Waterfall

overview: The protagonist of this documentary is Jerzy Górski, a triathlete with a history whose motto is “I have always wanted to be the best, no matter what I do”. His story, which was already the subject of the feature film by Łukasz Palkowski „The Fastest”, acquires the virtue of a personal testimony of a sportsman and former drug addict. In Górski’s turbulent life, combating addiction and the ambition of achieving increasingly better sports results are two sides of the same coin – the ability to overcome your body barriers in order to get to the top.
title: World Champion

overview: Part of the Optofonica #1 series
title: Vento Ignis

overview: Part of the Optofonica #1 series
title: Raindrops #7

overview: Part of the Optofonica #1 series.
title: Mount Magnet

overview: Part of the Optofonica #1 series
title: Untitled Sound Objects

overview: This is a story of one summer that ends along with the Youth. A village guy Seryoga looks at the world through a hole made in a poster of Tatyana Bulanova. A girl from a big city Nastya is just about to explore the world. Seryoga, Pashok and Redhead Mashka drag Nastya to the journey of their youth called 'Yof'. It is pretty hard to get out of it, it is impossible to forget it, you will always keep it in your memory like a song from the 90s.
title: Yof

overview: Part of the Optofonica #1 series
title: Skif++

overview: Part of the Optofonica #1 series
title: Xscape

overview: The only three disciples of Carlos Castaneda (at the time of the first airing); fierce guardian warriors ("Chocmools") demonstrate the techniques of Tensegrity, ancient magical movements that are part of the heritage of sorcerers of ancient Mexico. These movements enable the practitioner to store greater amounts of energy, expand awareness , and increase purpose. They discuss the Sorcerer's Way.
title: Bridging Heaven & Earth: Carlos Castaneda

overview: A woman who was hitchhiking ends up in the hospital after being raped. She relives the incident in nightmarish slow-motion, questioning her choices.
title: Hitchhiking: The Road to Rape

overview: Very high heels tap against the pier's wooden slats. Nineteen-year-old Laurine, a beautiful young woman, has come to meet her lover Olivier, who is spending his vacation with his cousins on the small island of Bréhat, just like he does every summer. Laurine quickly becomes the butt of some people's jokes and secretly desired by others.
title: Coqueluche

overview: 1000 : Oru Note Paranja Katha (English: 1000 - Story narrated by rupee note) is a 2015 Indian Malayalam thriller film directed by A. R. C. Nair. The film features Bharath, Mukesh and Maqbool Salmaan in the lead roles along with Leema Babu and Kalaranjini in key supporting roles. The film was released worldwide on 13 February 2015.
title: 1000: Oru Note Paranja Katha

overview: Lahmogie Institute film courtesy of their Ohgig Eeyahn Studies Department.
title: Ohgig Eeyah! Ohgig Eeyah! Ohgig Eeyah! A Journey Through That Hermit Nation

overview: Short anthropological film with music culled from Tuluum Shimmering's album of the same name.

overview: Part one of Tuluum Shimmering's 'A Film Without End'.
title: A Film Without End - 1

overview: Part two of Tuluum Shimmering's 'A Film Without End'.
title: A Film Without End - 2

overview: Going out for a lemonade with Dad is not a bad idea, especially if you happen to invent dynamite afterwards. A short and almost true story about Alfred Nobel.
title: Alfred

overview: Dean’s work is characterized by a sense of history, time and place, light quality, and the essence of the film itself. In line with these themes, the project will compose of a two-screen 35 mm film installation celebrating the quality and techniques of photochemical film. Derived from the origin of her own sister’s name, Antigone takes its starting point from the undramatized part between two of Sophocles’ three Theban plays, Oedipus Rex and Oedipus at Colonus, whose mythological character, Antigone, guides her blind and lame father, Oedipus, through the wilderness. The film will underscore the importance of film experimentation and highlight the endeavor of film, as a medium, to find a form between art, cinema and theater.
title: Antigone

overview: A portrait of three actors of different generations who have all portrayed Hamlet: David Warner, Stephen Dillane and Ben Whishaw.
title: His Picture In Little

overview: Two pears dissolve in a bottle of Schnapps.
title: Prisoner Pair

overview: A beautiful happily married woman seemingly shoots her husband in cold blood, however when arrested she claims that the dead man is not her husband, much to the disbelief of the investigating officers, who are determined to unearth the mystery.
title: Perfect Strangers

overview: Coming of age story about a young adult who is living out of his car and his journey to get his life together.
title: 29 to Life

overview: Alan Freeman, Brian Matthew and Kent Walton present the 'Top Of The Pops' of 1964 with performances from The Four Pennies, Millie, The Merseybeats and The Migil Five.
title: Swinging U.K.

overview: Farhan, a young introvert guy who has been struggling with his sexuality and spirituality, had crush on his new neighbor who made him question about being what he wants and what his God wants.
title: Abid

overview: Based on the comic book series of the same name by Tetsumi Dokou and Makio Hara.
title: Dochinpira: Gekijô-ban
The Journey – Stories from the 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa

overview: Based on the long running manga of the same name by Sadao Shouji.
title: Salaryman Senka: Tanshin Funin

overview: Sylva is the tenth album by American jazz fusion group Snarky Puppy, released on May 26, 2015. It was a collaboration between the band and the Metropole Orkest from the Netherlands. It won the Grammy Award for Best Contemporary Instrumental Album at the 58th Annual Grammy Awards.
title: Snarky Puppy & Metropole Orkest: Sylva

overview: A hit man discovers a secret about his boss while on assignment and must fight to save himself and his wife.
title: War Path

overview: Fear & Loathing IX was a live event by Insane Championship Wrestling which took place at The SSE Hydro on 20 November 2016 in Glasgow, Scotland. It is the company's biggest show of the year and this event marks the company's debut show at The SSE Hydro. It is the third year in a row that the company has broken its all-time attendance record at Fear and Loathing
title: ICW Fear and Loathing IX

overview: War refugees begin new lives in a small Massachusetts town.
title: The Cummington Story

overview: Trixi is Dwoskin’s most convulsive version of his recurrent theme: the confrontation of a solitary girl with the camera. Shot in one continuous 8-hour session. Trixi records Beatrice Cordua’s responses to the situation, from initial shyness, fear and withdrawal through teasing and posturing to naked surrender and final exhaustion …. The camera is highly mobile; often confronting the girl in extreme close-ups, sometimes swooping down from overhead, sometimes searching to “recapture” her …. The camera itself is the object of erotic desire, [in] the sense of giving a performance shifting imperceptibly in a helpless self-exposure in response to its constant stare. Clearly, the form of the film was dictated by the response of the performer. Beatrice Cordua proves Dwoskin’s most expressive subject to date, and the film is correspondingly “open,” the camera having been willing to choose its tactics as direct responses.
title: Trixi

overview: Indian Kannada romantic film.
title: Rhaatee

overview: The protagonist, a TV reporter fights to stop illegal activities around the city.
title: Sipaayi

overview: Film about growing up in a small village in Azerbaijan.
title: The Window of Sadness

overview: A young professional wakes up hanging upside-down in a warehouse with no recollection of how he got there. As he tries to escape and piece together what happened, he begins to uncover a nightmarish plot involving him and his loved ones.
title: Shift

overview: "A collection of footage from my friends or by my friends and me. It is amazing the number of events recorded by various means around London. Sowesto contains the opening of Region Gallery, The First Canadian Happening, Barbara Ann Scott in St. Marys, Nihilist events, etc." — Greg Curnoe
title: Sowesto

overview: Salim Shaheen film from Afghanistan
title: Fearless Martyr
The Sweet Algorithm
overview: As digital multiples and shuffles of Anita Ekberg and Marcello Mastroianni wade through the Trevi Fountain from LA DOLCE VITA, THE SWEET ALGORITHM continues Gregg Biermann's series of films dissecting and repurposing classic film scenes into pulsating, almost hypnotic collage works.
